text:
Hello, i have a question on the API LOAD HubSpot pushes to an app.

1. Let's say we have 12 clients in HubSpot, all are large users, sending text messages via our ProTexting app
2. What load should we expect, when they send all simultaneously?
Thank you,

Paul  <#CCQ7H31D5|developer-tools>

> Hello @All
> I have a question on HubSpot Forms.
> 
> I have a website which has multiple HubSpot Forms. When I try to submit, it gets submitted on sometime and it is not submitted for sometimes. I suspect that if there are multiple form submission happens from the same IP / region, HubSpot is blocking the Form Submission. Why I came to this is that when I click submit button, No URL like (<https://forms.hsforms.com/submissions/v3>) is not being called from the browser and no  error code is returned in browser console as well. please help me to fix this.
> 
> Thanks
> Selva D

Hello @All,

I am trying to embed the HubSpot CRM within Twilio Flex, and when navigating I sometimes see the error: _Refused to frame '<https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/>' because an ancestor violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "frame-ancestors 'self' <http://app.HubSpot.com|app.HubSpot.com>_

From speaking with support, I understand that due to a recent security update to prevent attacks that operate through iframes, some content will be blocked.

Is there a list of what can and cannot be viewed via iframe on a third party site? e.g. I can view contact records but not the conversations inbox

Hello @all
I'm HubSpot beginner and try to get started with API
First Step, from what I have read, is to use "<https://github.com/HubSpot/sample-apps-oauth>"
I have done (in fact "I think I have") all steps (created developper account, created an app, with redirect local
scopes are set to "`crm.objects.contacts.read crm.objects.contacts.write forms" and redirect url to localhost:3000/oauth-callback`
After following steps  as mentionned,

How to run locally
1. The first steps is to <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/developer-tools-overview|create a HubSpot developer account>. This is where you will create and manage HubSpot apps.
2. Next <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/creating-an-app|create an app>. On the "App info" tab, You will be prompted to fill out some basic information about your app. This includes name, description, logo, etc.
3. Lastly, in the "Auth" tab, you will be provided with a Client ID & Client secret (used in the next step). To ensure your app is compatible with this sample app, set the "Redirect URL" ("<http://localhost:3000/oauth-callback>" for Node), and select "Contacts" from the "Scopes" list.
4. Copy the .env.template file into a file named .env in the folder of the language you want to use. For example:
```cp node/.env.template node/.env```
1. Paste your HubSpot Client Id and HubSpot Client Secret as the value for HubSpot_CLIENT_ID and HubSpot_CLIENT_SECRET in .env
2. Follow the language instructions on how to run. For example, if you want to run the Node server:
```cd node # there's a README in this folder with instructions
npm install
npm run dev```

I have this message : *Couldn’t complete the connection*
*Insufficient scopes were provided. Please contact the app developer.*
Any idea ?

Hey you guys, I am not too experienced in the feedback survey tool. But is there any way for me, in a retro perspective, to sum up all answers in a specific question and get an average score for that question? I have played around a bit but cant seem to figure it out..

Well HubSpot just sends webhooks to your endpoint, so 12 simultaneous requests should be fine for one server. I would recommend setting up the server in nodejs because the speed and it can handle multiple requests at a time
That is soooo nice, I'll definitely be using this. Thanks <@U3T21PDBK>
What does your install url look like? you can edit out the client id if you want to

<https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=92dbccfe-e857-4c4e-a002-68c2010899f7&redirect_uri=http://localhost:3000/oauth-callback&scope=crm.objects.contacts.read|https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=92dbccfe-e857-4c4e-a002-68c20108[…]calhost:3000/oauth-callback&scope=crm.objects.contacts.read>
Yeah so you're missing your other scopes
All three scopes need to be listed

I have put back all three scopes. The install url is now <https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=92dbccfe-e857-4c4e-a002-68c2010899f7&redirect_uri=http://localhost:3000/oauth-callback&scope=forms%20crm.objects.contacts.read%20crm.objects.contacts.write|https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=92dbccfe-e857-4c4e-a002-68c20108[…]ms%20crm.objects.contacts.read%20crm.objects.contacts.write>

And I have always message "Couldn’t complete the connection
Insufficient scopes were provided. Please contact the app developer." when runnig localhost:3000
my .env

HubSpot_CLIENT_ID=92dbccfe-e857-4c4e-a002-68c2010xxxxxx
HubSpot_CLIENT_SECRET=761bfe09-5e5f-4e27-a581-4dc5202xxxxx
Delete the above
You really don't want to share your secret
You also mentioned having the forms scope
account is a "developper account"
so only crm.contacts.read and crm.contacts.write ?
Well add all the scopes that you've selected in your app settings page

OK, in my app settings I have now
`crm.objects.contacts.read crm.objects.contacts.write`

npm install
npm run dev
<http://localhost:3000/>
clic on "Authorize"
Then select my developper account

Insufficient scopes were provided. Please contact the app developer."

the updated one

<https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=92dbccfe-e857-4c4e-a002-68c2010899f7&redirect_uri=http://localhost:3000/oauth-callback&scope=crm.objects.contacts.read%20crm.objects.contacts.write|https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=92dbccfe-e857-4c4e-a002-68c20108[…]cope=crm.objects.contacts.read%20crm.objects.contacts.write>
Is there another place to parameter theses scopes ?
It works fine for me
Just installed the app
How do you do to "install the app" ?
you can probably also delete the "-eu1" from the url
I just used the url that you posted, and I didn't get any bad scopes error

I am redireted to :
<https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=92dbccfe-e857-4c4e-a002-68c2010899f7&redirect_uri=http%3A%2F%2Flocalhost%3A3000%2Foauth-callback&scope=crm.objects.contacts.read|https://app.HubSpot.com/oauth/authorize?client_id=92dbccfe-e857-4c4e-a002-68c2010899[…]lhost%3A3000%2Foauth-callback&scope=crm.objects.contacts.read>

then I select my developper account among five accounts :
<http://HubSpot-developers-1ey2tw7.com|HubSpot-developers-1ey2tw7.com>

Couldn’t complete the connection
Insufficient scopes were provided. Please contact the app developer.
I suppose that's a very basic thing that i do wrong.

Yeah so I think that's what's causing your issue can you try using the developer test account
OK, 10 minutes to crete the accounty, the app and I'm going to tell you if it works with test account.
Cool cool
Hey guys, Can anyone help me with this

Connect Agent Portal to HubSpot CRM via API. This document should provide clarity for a
developer to consume the API and finish the integration

No you can connect normal apps

Yes but can you install the app on the test account?
Ok, not "create an app" but "install the app" ... Where I can click to find out this ...
Use the link from above and when you get to the account screen click on your test account
When I click on the "test account" profile i go to "<https://app-eu1.HubSpot.com/discover/26599112/library/dashboards>"

I disconnect ....
I connect :
      <https://app.HubSpot.com/myaccounts-beta>
I have a list of accounts
   - If I choose a test account

   - If I choose my developper account

          .  but I when I click on an app I cannot affcet another account

Ho can I do ?
If i refer to "<https://github.com/HubSpot/sample-apps-oauth>" it says that's a "<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/developer-tools-overview|HubSpot developer account>." that has to be used ...
Yes but you can only install apps on non developer app accounts
Ok, so how I can do to make something working ?

I’ve experienced an odd issue on the last two launches our team has performed. It was a simple redesign with content staging, <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-pages/redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging|similar to this process>. Many of the links (done using ‘one of your pages’ to ensure the page is attached to an ID) disconnect after the push from staging to live. After the push, in edit mode, the page ID is highlighted in red like the page doesn’t exist, but it does exist. The fix is for our team to go back into edit the page and reconnect the link. Not a big lift for small site, but for a large site, it’s extremely time intensive and doesn’t reflect well to our clients. My expectation is that the links stay, well, linked :smile: Has anyone else experience this issue recently?
I have seen the same thing multiple times. never found the cause. Its almost the like the original page ID changes when launching from staging
Right? Next time I’ll have to check the ID referenced in the module’s link field, then compare it to the live page ID.
It’s super frustrating though. I’ve been working with content staging in HubSpot for years and never experienced it until the past month or so. I wonder if there’s been some kind of breaking change.
Maybe when your link field points to a page in staging. The ID of the staged page changes, because it gets copied over to the live page? And the staged pages gets deleted or something
It is super frustrating, sometimes we just use relative links. Which is dumb...
Yeah, that very well could be. To make things even more confusing is that it only happens to _some_ of the staged pages, not all.

There’s essentially two ways to stage pages. 1. create a new staged page or 2. stage from existing. I’ve always advocated to stage from existing if you’re replacing a page. However, sometimes that step is missed and someone stages a new page with the same URL and it simply gets replaced on push…only difference being you’ll see that URL Conflict warning. But launch still seems to work as expected even with that conflict. Why is that warning even there? But if the 2nd method is buggy, I don’t even know. I’m suddenly nervous for every launch.
I have seen this happen - usually when the sandbox version of the page is linked and not the live version of the page (the one being replaced)

Not sure if you've tried it, but if you add a "content" page as an "external" URL then your links won't break, and in the past, HubSpot would automatically change these over to "content" link types after the site was pushed out of the sandbox. I haven't tested this in a while, so I'm not sure if that is still the case, but for large sites I usually recommend that the exact URL be used as "external" rather than using the page because it avoids this issue altogether.
Relative links suck to setup, and maybe with the changes to HubL it doesn't auto-associate them anymore

Thanks for that insight, Jennifer. The one issue our team would have in linking to the live version of the page rather than the staged, is that those links wouldn’t provide a great user experience during internal/client QA in that all links would direct to the old pages, rather than the new staged. But using the “external” in hopes that HubSpot automatically changes them over to “content” may be something. I really wish this workaround wouldn’t be the case, but it may be the best route. Thank you for that recommendation!

Yes, it does make it difficult to work on QA if you are testing internal links.

The sandbox links automatically create redirects to the live pages, I'm not sure why they would error out and show in red, that's the same thing that happens when a menu from a template is missing because it doesn't exist in the account.

I'd be curious to know if it has to do with how the pages are staged, as you mentioned previously
This message was deleted.
“brain-bending” ?
Can you please explain this a little more? What exactly are you trying to do?
